bibl.title: Ptolemaic Baths in front of the Temple of Karnak. A Brief Preliminary Report - November 2007.
bibl.note: Excavation. - Description of the baths: Tholos 1 and the hip-bathtubs; - Tholos 2, the stylized dolphins; - Room 3; - Room 6; - Room 5: drainage of the monument. - Interpretation and the parallels: circular rooms (tholoi) and hip-bathtubs; - Organization of rooms and basins. - Chronology and prospects for future research. - Appendix (by Thomas FAUCHER): The hoard of coins and the abandonment of the baths [316 coins found in a pot, buried probably between 140 and 114 BC, in a mud-brick structure that was built after the razing of the baths]. - Addendum (by Mansour BORAIK): The second tholos revealed.
